title.rendered: Taking chairs to throw into street, Spitting on door & throwing tab end in animal water bowl | 14th September 2024

content.rendered:
Summery:
On September 14, 2024, at approximately 07:15, the resident of 14 Pine Close once again engaged in a series of disruptive and concerning behaviors:

  1. Early morning disturbance: Shouting at 4 AM, presumably on the phone.
    likely unable to order his cocaine for the day, (usually the reason for his shouting)
  2. Suspicious activity, property damage and theft (around 7:15 AM):
    • Paced around front of our door while smoking
    • Discarded cigarette in pet water bowl
    • Repeatedly entered and exited his flat, surveying the area
    • Brought out his dog briefly
    • Spat on our door again
    • Took our chairs and walked towards the road
    • Quickly returned to his flat, passing a man walking a dog

This event are part of ongoing issues with this neighbor, indicating a pattern of problematic behavior.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDH  | The Police via 101

Details:
On September 14, 2024, at approximately 07:15 the resident of 14 Pine Close exhibited disruptive behavior yet again, including prolonged periods of walking around and shouting, presumably on the phone, at 4 AM. The situation escalated when the individual spat on our door, disposed of a half smoked cig in our pet water bowl turning it yellow, and removed our chairs, leaving them down the road. This incident has been reported to the police via 101, PC Daniel O’Neil via email, and Sam Palmer, our council representative, through One Call, who has been updated on the ongoing issues.

At approximately 7:15 AM, the neighbor emerged from his residence, smoking a cigarette while pacing in front of our door area. After two minutes of this behavior, he positioned himself near our outdoor chairs, which we use as a bird table due to a previous incident where he attempted to break in by smashing them against our door. He partially finished his cigarette and discarded it into the pet water bowl turning it yellow before returning to his flat.

Fifteen minutes later, the individual reappeared, briefly surveying the area before retreating to retrieve his dog. He then stood on the grass with the dog while continuing to look around, only to return the dog to his flat after a short period. Two minutes later, he reemerged, fixating on our door and chairs, he spat at our front door again, and walked past. He was then observed moving slowly across the area, seemingly checking for witnesses. He approached our chairs, stared at them, looked around once more, and proceeded to take them, walking towards the road. Finally, he hurriedly returned to his flat, walking past a man from over the road with his dog, Sid, in the process. (seen in at end of the longer uncut video).

Video (cut version): 3 Minutes, 50 Seconds long, coped main parts

Video (uncut version): 22 Minutes, 32 Seconds long
